paragraphs.body: Methods of transportation in the ${link_0} vary greatly from nation to nation, ranging from motorized transportation, like ${link_1}, to ${link_2}-based transportation, such as ${link_3}.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Methods of transportation in the Avatar World vary greatly from nation to nation, ranging from motorized transportation, like tank trains, to animal-based transportation, such as flying bison.

paragraphs.body: Prior to the ${link_0}, the ${link_1} and the ${link_2} relied exclusively on unpowered transportation methods, whereas the ${link_3} and ${link_4} had more advanced methods at their disposal.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Prior to the Hundred Year War, the Air Nomads and the Water Tribe relied exclusively on unpowered transportation methods, whereas the Earth Kingdom and Fire Nation had more advanced methods at their disposal.

paragraphs.body: Seventy years after the war's end, motorized transportation evolved significantly and became a typical sight within ${link_0}.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Seventy years after the war's end, motorized transportation evolved significantly and became a typical sight within Republic City.

paragraphs.body: The Air Nomads' use of ${link_0} extends to transportation. Without any external means of travel, Air Nomads can run great distances at high speeds. However, for longer journeys or for some applications, the Air Nomads make use of flying bison and gliders.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Air Nomads
paragraphs.text: The Air Nomads' use of airbending extends to transportation. Without any external means of travel, Air Nomads can run great distances at high speeds. However, for longer journeys or for some applications, the Air Nomads make use of flying bison and gliders.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - This was the primary long-range transportation used by Air Nomads. Flying bison use airbending to fly.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Air Nomads
paragraphs.text: Flying bison - This was the primary long-range transportation used by Air Nomads. Flying bison use airbending to fly.

paragraphs.body:
${link_0} - Air Nomads possessed staffs to aid their bending. They opened their staffs into gliders to fly.
 Windsurfing - ${link_1} made a makeshift wind surfboard out of his glider and a large piece of driftwood. It can be used for short distance travel over water.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Air Nomads
paragraphs.text:
Gliders - Air Nomads possessed staffs to aid their bending. They opened their staffs into gliders to fly.
 Windsurfing - Aang made a makeshift wind surfboard out of his glider and a large piece of driftwood. It can be used for short distance travel over water.

paragraphs.body: Windsurfing - ${link_1} made a makeshift wind surfboard out of his glider and a large piece of driftwood. It can be used for short distance travel over water.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Air Nomads
paragraphs.text: Windsurfing - ${link_1} made a makeshift wind surfboard out of his glider and a large piece of driftwood. It can be used for short distance travel over water.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - By 174 AG, wingsuits developed by ${link_1} became a common attire to be worn by the airbenders of the Air Nation and replaced the need to carry around a staff for gliding.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Air Nomads
paragraphs.text: Wingsuits - By 174 AG, wingsuits developed by Future Industries became a common attire to be worn by the airbenders of the Air Nation and replaced the need to carry around a staff for gliding.

paragraphs.body: The people of the Water Tribe always inhabit regions near water. Thus, their methods of transportation are mostly water-based, with a small variety of boats and larger ships used.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Water Tribe
paragraphs.text: The people of the Water Tribe always inhabit regions near water. Thus, their methods of transportation are mostly water-based, with a small variety of boats and larger ships used.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - Animals used in the Southern Water Tribe as transportation and beasts of burden.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Water Tribe
paragraphs.text: Arctic camel - Animals used in the Southern Water Tribe as transportation and beasts of burden.

paragraphs.body: Barges - These smaller boats are commonly used for transport around the Northern Water Tribe.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Water Tribe
paragraphs.text: Barges - These smaller boats are commonly used for transport around the Northern Water Tribe.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - These animals are used by the Northern Water Tribe as a means of transportation and towing.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Water Tribe
paragraphs.text: Buffalo yak - These animals are used by the Northern Water Tribe as a means of transportation and towing.

paragraphs.body: Canoe - A boat that is used for fishing, or short distance travel over water in the Southern Water Tribe.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Water Tribe
paragraphs.text: Canoe - A boat that is used for fishing, or short distance travel over water in the Southern Water Tribe.

paragraphs.body: Catamaran - Catamarans are used as a means of seaborne transportation. They can vary in size, ranging from being a one-person transport to being large enough to comfortably house a flying bison and six people.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Water Tribe
paragraphs.text: Catamaran - Catamarans are used as a means of seaborne transportation. They can vary in size, ranging from being a one-person transport to being large enough to comfortably house a flying bison and six people.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - They are used by ${link_1} warriors as transport ships for their small force of warriors.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Water Tribe
paragraphs.text: Cutter sailing ship - They are used by Southern Water Tribe warriors as transport ships for their small force of warriors.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - Avatar ${link_1} owned a tamed polar bear dog named ${link_2} whom she rode frequently while traveling in the South Pole and in Republic City.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Water Tribe
paragraphs.text: Polar bear dog - Avatar Korra owned a tamed polar bear dog named Naga whom she rode frequently while traveling in the South Pole and in Republic City.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - Used by members of the Southern Water Tribe after the Hundred Year War to cross the snowy landscape in the south.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Water Tribe
paragraphs.text: Snowmobile - Used by members of the Southern Water Tribe after the Hundred Year War to cross the snowy landscape in the south.

paragraphs.body: Swamp skiff - Used by the ${link_0}, these canoe-like crafts serve as transportation around the ${link_1}. The swamp people use waterbending to propel the skiffs and long poles to guide them through the waterways of the swamp.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Water Tribe
paragraphs.text: Swamp skiff - Used by the Foggy Swamp Tribe, these canoe-like crafts serve as transportation around the Foggy Swamp. The swamp people use waterbending to propel the skiffs and long poles to guide them through the waterways of the swamp.

paragraphs.body: The Earth Kingdom is vast and thus has a large variety of transportation for every need. Various methods emphasize speed, agility, or luxury.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Earth Kingdom
paragraphs.text: The Earth Kingdom is vast and thus has a large variety of transportation for every need. Various methods emphasize speed, agility, or luxury.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - Badgermoles can be useful for travel underground if the rider plays music. They are also domesticated for heavy labor purposes in other parts of the kingdom.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Earth Kingdom
paragraphs.text: Badgermole - Badgermoles can be useful for travel underground if the rider plays music. They are also domesticated for heavy labor purposes in other parts of the kingdom.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - Used by the Earth Kingdom ${link_1} and constructed by ${link_2}. Cheaper and of inferior quality compared to other contemporary airships.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Earth Kingdom
paragraphs.text: Ba Sing Se airship - Used by the Earth Kingdom Air Force and constructed by Cabbage Corp. Cheaper and of inferior quality compared to other contemporary airships.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - Used for desert travel.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Earth Kingdom
paragraphs.text: Camelephant - Used for desert travel.

paragraphs.body: Carriage - Animal-drawn carriages are used by the wealthy for transportation.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Earth Kingdom
paragraphs.text: Carriage - Animal-drawn carriages are used by the wealthy for transportation.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - Eel hounds are the fastest creatures on land or in water, and are thus very useful for the purposes of pursuit or interception.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Earth Kingdom
paragraphs.text: Eel hound - Eel hounds are the fastest creatures on land or in water, and are thus very useful for the purposes of pursuit or interception.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - Ferries are used to cross bodies of water, for example to ${link_1}.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Earth Kingdom
paragraphs.text: Ferry - Ferries are used to cross bodies of water, for example to Ba Sing Se.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - Giant beetles are used in the ${link_1} by the ${link_2} as pack animals and for transport.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Earth Kingdom
paragraphs.text: Giant beetle - Giant beetles are used in the Si Wong Desert by the beetle-headed merchants as pack animals and for transport.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - Used by Earth Kingdom settlers in the ${link_1} and constructed by the ${link_2}.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Earth Kingdom
paragraphs.text: Glider - Used by Earth Kingdom settlers in the Northern Air Temple and constructed by the mechanist.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - The monorail is a very fast method of transportation available to the citizens of Ba Sing Se, who would otherwise require three days to travel from one side of the city to the other. It is also a means of transportation available in the metal city of ${link_1}.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Earth Kingdom
paragraphs.text: Monorail - The monorail is a very fast method of transportation available to the citizens of Ba Sing Se, who would otherwise require three days to travel from one side of the city to the other. It is also a means of transportation available in the metal city of Zaofu.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - Ostrich horses are a popular method of transportation in rural areas of the Earth Kingdom, as they are versatile and resilient.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Earth Kingdom
paragraphs.text: Ostrich horse - Ostrich horses are a popular method of transportation in rural areas of the Earth Kingdom, as they are versatile and resilient.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - The ${link_1} uses a palanquin, an ultimate status symbol.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Earth Kingdom
paragraphs.text: Palanquin - The earth monarch uses a palanquin, an ultimate status symbol.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - Used by the sandbenders to traverse across the ${link_1}.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Earth Kingdom
paragraphs.text: Sand-sailer - Used by the sandbenders to traverse across the Si Wong Desert.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - Used by ${link_1} to pursue bounties. This creature can track scents across continents and travel across land incredibly quickly.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Earth Kingdom
paragraphs.text: Shirshu - Used by June to pursue bounties. This creature can track scents across continents and travel across land incredibly quickly.

paragraphs.body: The industrialized Fire Nation has many transportation methods. Some of them are among the fastest in the world, driven by steam. Others are more traditional, such as the palanquin.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Fire Nation
paragraphs.text: The industrialized Fire Nation has many transportation methods. Some of them are among the fastest in the world, driven by steam. Others are more traditional, such as the palanquin.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - Used by the ${link_1} to transport troops and attack enemy targets from the air. At least sixteen of these airships were constructed, and all but one were destroyed at the ${link_2}.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Fire Nation
paragraphs.text: Airship - Used by the Fire Nation Air Force to transport troops and attack enemy targets from the air. At least sixteen of these airships were constructed, and all but one were destroyed at the battle at Wulong Forest.

paragraphs.body: Barge - ${link_0}, ${link_1}, ${link_2}, and ${link_3} went for a vacation on ${link_4} on a small wooden luxury vessel built for use by Fire Nation nobles. This small vessel possesses no engines and is pulled by one ${link_5}.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Fire Nation
paragraphs.text: Barge - Azula, Zuko, Mai, and Ty Lee went for a vacation on Ember Island on a small wooden luxury vessel built for use by Fire Nation nobles. This small vessel possesses no engines and is pulled by one sea lion.

paragraphs.body: Carriage - Animal-drawn carriages are used by the wealthy for transportation.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Fire Nation
paragraphs.text: Carriage - Animal-drawn carriages are used by the wealthy for transportation.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - Before their near extinction, dragons could be used as transport.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Fire Nation
paragraphs.text: Dragon - Before their near extinction, dragons could be used as transport.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - Carriage-pulling creatures.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Fire Nation
paragraphs.text: Dragon moose - Carriage-pulling creatures.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - Used in the ${link_1} as a method of transportation across the boiling lake. It uses long, strong metal cables to navigate over the scalding hot water.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Fire Nation
paragraphs.text: Gondola - Used in the Boiling Rock as a method of transportation across the boiling lake. It uses long, strong metal cables to navigate over the scalding hot water.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - Small two-man balloon used by the Fire Nation Air Force to attack ground units alongside airships.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Fire Nation
paragraphs.text: Hot air balloon - Small two-man balloon used by the Fire Nation Air Force to attack ground units alongside airships.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - A mode of aquatic transportation used for high-speed travel over rivers.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Fire Nation
paragraphs.text: Jet ski - A mode of aquatic transportation used for high-speed travel over rivers.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - Used in the Hundred Year War as cavalry, specifically by the ${link_1}, but also by others, like Zuko.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Fire Nation
paragraphs.text: Komodo rhino - Used in the Hundred Year War as cavalry, specifically by the Rough Rhinos, but also by others, like Zuko.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - Large animals that are ridden like a horse.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Fire Nation
paragraphs.text: Mongoose lizard - Large animals that are ridden like a horse.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - Royalty and the nobility use palanquins, an ultimate status symbol.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Fire Nation
paragraphs.text: Palanquin - Royalty and the nobility use palanquins, an ultimate status symbol.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - Used in the mountains by bandits and poachers.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Fire Nation
paragraphs.text: Puma goat - Used in the mountains by bandits and poachers.

paragraphs.body: Ship - One of the fastest methods of transportation in the world, seagoing ships are used widely in the Fire Nation.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Fire Nation
paragraphs.text: Ship - One of the fastest methods of transportation in the world, seagoing ships are used widely in the Fire Nation.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - Used by Azula as a means to quickly track Aang and his friends.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Fire Nation
paragraphs.text: Tank train - Used by Azula as a means to quickly track Aang and his friends.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - A compact airplane that was manufactured by ${link_1} to be used by the ${link_2}. It was later repurposed by ${link_3}, who used Future Industries' resources to build them en masse.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Transportation not exclusive to nations
paragraphs.text: Biplane - A compact airplane that was manufactured by Hiroshi Sato to be used by the Equalists. It was later repurposed by Asami, who used Future Industries' resources to build them en masse.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - In the years following the Hundred Year War, Republic City produced modes of transportation such as motorcycles, mopeds, and cars, which are of a more recent and advanced degree of transportation. Some of the automobile models in Republic City include ${link_1} and the cheaper alternative known as the ${link_2}.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Transportation not exclusive to nations
paragraphs.text: Motor vehicle - In the years following the Hundred Year War, Republic City produced modes of transportation such as motorcycles, mopeds, and cars, which are of a more recent and advanced degree of transportation. Some of the automobile models in Republic City include Satomobiles and the cheaper alternative known as the Cabbage Car.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - A mode of aquatic transportation powered by gasoline. It can travel at very high speeds across water.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Transportation not exclusive to nations
paragraphs.text: Speedboat - A mode of aquatic transportation powered by gasoline. It can travel at very high speeds across water.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - A large ship used for transporting goods between various locations around the world.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Transportation not exclusive to nations
paragraphs.text: Steamship - A large ship used for transporting goods between various locations around the world.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - In industrialized areas, train systems were built to bypass road traffic and ease transportation time and costs.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Transportation not exclusive to nations
paragraphs.text: Train - In industrialized areas, train systems were built to bypass road traffic and ease transportation time and costs.

paragraphs.body: Tram and mine-cart system - Used primarily by the Equalists to travel through the tunnels beneath Republic City, the trams and mine-carts are vital in transporting goods and people between various Equalist hideouts.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Transportation not exclusive to nations
paragraphs.text: Tram and mine-cart system - Used primarily by the Equalists to travel through the tunnels beneath Republic City, the trams and mine-carts are vital in transporting goods and people between various Equalist hideouts.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} - Republic City also has an intricate network of trolleys that serves as a means of public transportation that people can use to get around the city.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Transportation not exclusive to nations
paragraphs.text: Trolley - Republic City also has an intricate network of trolleys that serves as a means of public transportation that people can use to get around the city.

paragraphs.body:
Each of the four nations have their own bending-powered transportation: the Water Tribe has waterbending-powered submarines; the Earth Kingdom has earthbending-powered tanks; the Fire Nation has hot air balloons; and the Air Nomads have air gliders.
 The mechanist designed three of these four apparatuses himself and constructed his own version of the air glider.
section: Transportation in the World of Avatar
Trivia
paragraphs.text:
Each of the four nations have their own bending-powered transportation: the Water Tribe has waterbending-powered submarines; the Earth Kingdom has earthbending-powered tanks; the Fire Nation has hot air balloons; and the Air Nomads have air gliders.
 The mechanist designed three of these four apparatuses himself and constructed his own version of the air glider.
